description: {"blocks":[{"key":"82u5j","text":"Induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC)-derived organoids provide models to study human organ development. Single-cell transcriptomics enable highly resolved descriptions of cell states within these systems; however, approaches are needed to directly measure lineage relationships. Here we establish iTracer, a lineage recorder that combines reporter barcodes with inducible CRISPR–Cas9 scarring and is compatible with single-cell and spatial transcriptomics. We apply iTracer to explore clonality and lineage dynamics during cerebral organoid development and identify a time window of fate restriction as well as variation in neurogenic dynamics between progenitor neuron families. We incorporate gene perturbation (iTracer-perturb) and assess the effect of mosaicTSC2 mutations on cerebral organoid development. Our data shed light on how lineages and fates are established during cerebral organoid formation. More broadly, our techniques can be adapted in any iPSC-derived culture system to dissect lineage alterations during normal or perturbed development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":762,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l3na","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lvpe","text":"This protocol describes the creation of the iTracer vectors. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: lineage tracing, barcodes, genomic lineage tracer, iTracer
manuscript_citation: He, Z., Maynard, A., Jain, A. et al. Lineage recording in human cerebral organoids. Nat Methods 19, 90–99 (2022). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-021-01344-8

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cu4qq","text":"Calculate the pmol of 1ul of the barcodes (step #7) and the pmol of 1ul of the plasmid fragment (step #13) (this calculator can help https://ch.promega.com/resources/tools/biomath/)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":47}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pgkg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e52ti","text":"Example:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6nml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"887n7","text":"barcodes = 63bp with 0.0238ug/ul = 0.57pmol DNA  (in 1ul)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1int0","text":"plasmid fragment (iTracer-R) = 5613bp with 0.2044ug/ul = 0.055pmol  (in 1ul)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3uc84","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dnen","text":"barcodes should be 10 fold the molar excess of an insert, therefore:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fe1v","text":"10 x 0.055 pmol (the plasmid fragment) = 0.55 pmol (the molarity we need of our barcodes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccqhb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gos7","text":"In this example we will use 1ul of barcodes for 1ul of vector in the gibson assembly","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"70399464B59511ECB1440A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ch.promega.com/resources/tools/biomath"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"401j7","text":"For the plasmid + barcode reaction: combine the reaction and equally plate the total reaction volume (~273uL each) on Ampicillin plates (x3 15cm square plates). Add extra SOC buffer to help evenly spread the volume on the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oac9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57rde","text":"For the control plasmid only reaction: plate ~273ul of total reaction volume, add extra SOC buffer to help evenly spread the volume on the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35k58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp9bd","text":" Incubate plates   (~16hrat  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":17,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3eb6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":57600,"guid":"9C5DE197B29E11ECAC6F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9C5DE36EB29E11ECAC6F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

You now have barcoded iTracer plasmids ready for electroporation into your cells!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"872om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"AF5D90ADB29E11ECAC6F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nqcn","text":"Inspect control plate vs plasmid+barcode plates. There should be a notable difference, where the control plate has few colonies compared to the plasmid+barcode reaction plates. If this is observed continue to step #19.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mr0q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lfhl","text":"If this is not the case you may have an error and will need to troubleshoot (control plates with many colonies may have plasmid carryover from from the backbone fragment clean up Step #14, do these steps and repeat). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
